results.deck: Mana Khemia is the 9th entry in the Atelier series. The game is a quest based RPG where players adventure on various missions to complete the game. Unlike the ordinary classic style RPG, alchemy is the main focus of the game, meaning players will discover and create items and weapons.
results.name: Mana Khemia: Alchemists of Al-Revis

results.deck: A third-person action game that has players assuming the role of an underworld hit man caught in a war between two crime families.
results.name: Trigger Man

results.deck: A computer board game envisioned by the Dragon Quest designer Yuji Horii, Itadaki Street Special features characters from both the Dragon Quest and Final Fantasy franchises.
results.name: Itadaki Street Special

results.deck: Battlefield 2: Modern Combat brings the modern military Battlefield experience from the PC to sixth-generation consoles.
results.name: Battlefield 2: Modern Combat

results.deck: This RPG based on the Digimon TV show allows you to play as your favorite Digimon.
results.name: Digimon World 4

results.deck: Metal Gear Solid 2: Substance is an updated version of Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons of Liberty containing the original game while adding hundreds of VR missions, a theatre mode and more. It was originally released on the Xbox and later made it onto PS2 and PC.
results.name: Metal Gear Solid 2: Substance

results.deck: Shox is a racing game that is very unique and exciting.
results.name: Shox

results.deck: Find out what happened two years before the hit anime series Eureka 7.
results.name: Eureka Seven Vol. 1: The New Wave

results.deck: Virtua Quest is a 3rd person Action RPG set in the Virtua Fighter universe.
results.name: Virtua Quest

results.deck: NBA Live 08 is another yearly installment in EA's NBA Live series. The Washington Wizards' Gilbert Arenas is featured on the cover.
results.name: NBA Live 08

results.deck: A licensed Charlie's Angels game featuring the likes of stars such as Cameron Diaz and Drew Barrymore, the game asks players to go hunt down national monuments which have disappeared. The game is infamous for a rather sour reception.
results.name: Charlie's Angels

results.deck: Naval war game with customizable ships
results.name: Naval Ops: Warship Gunner

results.deck: The King of Fighters '98 Ultimate Match is a rebalanced version of The King of Fighters '98 with new characters.
results.name: The King of Fighters '98 Ultimate Match

results.deck: NHL 2K7 was the seventh game in the series released on Xbox, Xbox360, PlayStation2, and PlayStation3.
results.name: NHL 2K7

results.deck: Egg Mania is a puzzle game that takes inspirations from Tetris. Two egg-themed characters are pitted against eachother to reach the hot air baloon at the top of stage first by building a platform made out of Tetris pieces.
results.name: Egg Mania: Eggstreme Madness

results.deck: The fifth game in the Growlanser series.
results.name: Growlanser: Heritage of War

results.deck: Play as a young hero named Jarik in this fantasy role-playing game from Stormfront Studios.
results.name: The Legend of Alon D'ar

results.deck: NCAA Football 2007 is the 10th game in the NCAA Football series. The theme for NCAA Football 2007 is "Turn the Tide." It features former USC Trojan and Heisman Winner Reggie Bush, who currently plays for the New Orleans Saints. This is the first next-generation NCAA Football game.
results.name: NCAA Football 07

results.deck: The famous Monopoly board game comes to the current generation of consoles featuring a variety of new features, including mini-games.
results.name: Monopoly: Here & Now Worldwide Edition

results.deck: Bleach: Blade Battlers is a 3D fighting game for the PS2. It is based on the popular anime and manga series Bleach.
results.name: Bleach: Blade Battlers

results.deck: The 5th installment to EA's NASCAR racing series, NASCAR 2002 was released on the PS1, PS2 and XBOX.
results.name: NASCAR Thunder 2002

results.deck: Rugby 06 continues the EA's rugby franchise by adding updated rosters and graphical upgrades.
results.name: Rugby 06

results.deck: Fate/Stay Night is a visual novel that chronicles a war between seven Magi for the Holy Grail. Each Magus summons a heroic spirit from history or legend to help fight with them and obtain the power to grant wishes.
results.name: Fate/stay night

results.deck: Bandai Namco will release Mobile Suit Gundam 00: Gundam Meisters for PlayStation 2 in Japan in October 2008, a new 3D action game based on the Gundam 00 TV series
results.name: Mobile Suit Gundam 00: Gundam Meisters

results.deck: The sequel to Dance Dance Revolution SuperNOVA, you partake in a dancing experience by stepping in the direction the on-screen indicator tells you, with the aid of a dance mat or gamepad.
results.name: Dance Dance Revolution SuperNOVA 2

results.deck: A Christian-themed quiz game and minigame collection.
results.name: The Bible Game

results.deck: Released on the PS2 just prior to Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 in an attempt to cash in on the popularity of the THPS Franchise.
results.name: ESPN X-Games Skateboarding

results.deck: Backyard Baseball '10 is a MLB licensed baseball game for kids.
results.name: Backyard Baseball '10

results.deck: NBA Shootout is the 5th iteration of the franchise and is the first of the series to appear on the PlayStation 2. Released in 2000 for the PlayStation and early 2001 for the PlayStation 2, It featured only minor improvements over the previous entry in the series, including a refined touch system and a graphics overhaul on the PS2 version.
results.name: NBA ShootOut 2001

results.deck: Dawn of Mana is a Japanese action-adventure game set in the World of Mana. Going from 2D to a 3D world, Dawn of Mana explores the truth behind the legend of the Mana Tree and the Sword of Mana.
results.name: Dawn of Mana

results.deck: NBA ShootOut 2003 is the seventh game in Sony's basketball simulation franchise. The PS1 version of the game continued the trend of bringing almost no improvements from previous entries, while the PS2 release was the first to feature the Create Dunk on the platform.
results.name: NBA ShootOut 2003

results.deck: A non-educational Carmen Sandiego game, featuring stealth, platforming, and action.
results.name: Carmen Sandiego: The Secret of the Stolen Drums

results.deck: Isometric WWII-themed shooter from Acclaim.
results.name: Combat Elite: WWII Paratroopers

results.deck: Gretzky NHL 2005 was a hockey game released exclusively on the PlayStation2.
results.name: Gretzky NHL 2005

results.deck: The most recent Gretzky NHL game by Page 44 Studios.
results.name: Gretzky NHL 06

results.deck: Downhill Domination is a mountain biking game that focuses on fast and dangerous downhill descents, on-bike combat and gigantic jumps and tricks. The game is from the same team that brought us Twisted Metal: Black.
results.name: Downhill Domination

results.deck: The Playstation 2 sequel to Smash Court Tennis offers player a deeper tennis simulation experience, expanding on existing features, aswell as adding new modes.
results.name: Smash Court Tennis: Pro Tournament 2

results.deck: Protect America and freedom from enemy forces in urban and rural warfare in SOCOM: U.S. Navy SEALs Combined Assault.
results.name: SOCOM: U.S. Navy SEALs - Combined Assault

results.deck: Not to be confused with the 5th game in this series, this is actually the 12th Guitar Freaks and 11th Drummania game.
results.name: GuitarFreaks V & DrumMania V

results.deck:
Considered one of the best Winning Eleven games in the long series,as well as the first to feature actual licensed teams. 

Released for : xbox, ps2
results.name: World Soccer Winning Eleven 9

results.deck: A 2D fighting game co-developed by doujin circles Type-Moon and French-Bread based off of the visual novel "Tsukihime". Act Cadenza was the first arcade port of the series, and would later see a release on the Playstation 2 on August 10, 2006.
results.name: Melty Blood: Act Cadenza

results.deck: Help the Crisis Response Team stop a nuclear weapon named Project Poseidon with the sequel to Winback.
results.name: WinBack 2: Project Poseidon

results.deck: A game that consists of mini sports games.
results.name: Eye Toy: Play Sports

results.deck: Cell-shaded action skateboarding game, in which performing tricks kills invasive aliens, called "Gawoo."  Includes a fingerboard-style controller that attaches to analog sticks.
results.name: Yanya Caballista: City Skater

results.deck:
Excellent soccer sim. Made by Konami.
Produced by Shingo "Seabass" Takatsuka
Release on: Ps2
Release date: Oct 2003
results.name: World Soccer Winning Eleven 7

results.deck: Konami's first go at snowboarding games, stays true to the sport with painstaking realism.
results.name: ESPN Winter X-Games Snowboarding

results.deck: From its defunct ESPN Winter X-Games Snowboarding series, Konami takes the basic gameplay and pro riders, and adds on a story of a ski slope overtaken by villains, called "Boardroids", as well as an on-board fighting mechanic.
results.name: Snowboarding Evolution

results.deck: NCAA Football 08 is the 11th installment of the franchise. This version sported a new engine and control scheme, allowing for a different gameplay experience than previous iterations.
results.name: NCAA Football 08

results.deck: Taito Memories II Joukan (Vol. 1) is a compilation of 25 Taito arcade games for the Playstation 2.
results.name: Taito Memories II Joukan

results.deck: 7 Wonders 2 is similar to puzzle games such as Tetris or Bejewled, but rather than outright copying these popular games it takes the important aspects of both and combines them to create a game that is both fun and challenging.
results.name: 7 Wonders 2

results.deck: Friends: The One With All The Trivia does exactly what it says on the tin, offering up questions related to one of the most successful sit-coms of all time.
results.name: Friends: The One with All the Trivia

results.deck: Samurai Warriors 2 Empires is a more "strategic" version of Samurai Warriors 2.  Choose or create your character and lead them into historical battles from the Sengoku period of Japan.
results.name: Samurai Warriors 2: Empires

results.deck: Take the role of a cameraman in a news team set out to investigate a horrific monster invasion in Chicago.
results.name: Michigan: Report from Hell

results.deck: Airblade is the spiritual successor to Trickstyle, a hoverboarding game developed by Criterion Games.
results.name: Airblade

results.deck: The first-game in Sandlot's Earth Defence Force series, see's the player adorn the-role of a  Storm-1 unit deployed with the sole-purpose of stopping the menacing 'ravengers', who have launched a full-scale invasion of Earth with the-intent of annihilating-it, utterly.
results.name: Monster Attack

results.deck: Alien Syndrome is a cooperative, top-down, run & gun shooter with aliens developed by SEGA as an arcade game in 1987. Compared to other shooters at the time, Alien Syndrome introduced a horror atmosphere in an isolated space station, along with some exploration and survival elements.
results.name: Alien Syndrome

results.deck: A game set in the Tetsujin/Gigantor universe where you control gigantic robots with a remote control.
results.name: Tetsujin 28-Go

results.deck: In Remote Control Dandy SF you control giant robots with a remote control.
results.name: Remote Control Dandy SF

results.deck: A dancing rhythm-matching & button recognition game with up-beat Japanese music.  PS2 update to the classic Bust a Groove series.
results.name: Dance Summit 2001

results.deck: Samurai Champloo: Sidetracked is an action game based on the anime series of the same name, developed by Grasshopper Manufacture and published by Namco Bandai Games in April 2006.
results.name: Samurai Champloo: Sidetracked

results.deck: Race trucks at speeds over 150 mph.  Race them around 15 tracks and in 6 different modes.
results.name: Super Trucks Racing

results.deck: ATV Offroad Fury 3 is the 3rd game in the ATV Offroad Fury franchise.
results.name: ATV Offroad Fury 3

results.deck: ATV Offroad Fury 4 is the 4th game in the ATV Offroad Fury franchise preceding ATV Offroad Fury 3.
results.name: ATV Offroad Fury 4

results.deck: Hibana, a government ninja is tasked with defending Japan from hellspawn and collecting the pieces of the cursed sword Akujiki after the events of Shinobi on PS2.
results.name: Nightshade

results.deck: Protect the Earth from an onslaught of giant ants and UFOs! Released on the Sony Playstation 2 in Japan and later in Europe.
results.name: Global Defence Force

results.deck: Platform game based on the Jet Fusion episodes of the Jimmy Neutron animated TV show.
results.name: Jimmy Neutron: Jet Fusion

results.deck: This game is the story behind the popular "Scorpion King" character.
results.name: The Scorpion King: Rise of the Akkadian

results.deck: Remake of the first Virtual On game (Saturn) on PlayStation 2.
results.name: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol. 31: Dennou Senki Virtual-On

results.deck: Power Rangers: Super Legends is a video game based on the action/adventure television franchise Power Rangers. It was released for the Nintendo DS (Oct 16th), PlayStation 2 (Oct 30th) and PC (Dec 5th). The game was released as part of the 15th Anniversary of Power Rangers.
results.name: Power Rangers: Super Legends

results.deck: LMA Manager 2007 is the eighth game in the LMA Manager series. It was released on PlayStation 2, Xbox 360 and PC.
results.name: LMA Manager 2007

results.deck: This a ps2 platform game
results.name: Inspector Gadget Mad Robots Invasion

results.deck: Aqua Teen Hunger Force: Zombie Ninja Pro-Am is a golf-action-racing game starring the cast of the Adult Swim cartoon. The game's quality is so poor that it's been suggested that it was released that way intentionally to keep in line with the show's bizarre sense of humor.
results.name: Aqua Teen Hunger Force: Zombie Ninja Pro-Am

results.deck: A cel-shaded team based fighting game featuring characters from the popular manga and TV show.
results.name: InuYasha: Feudal Combat

results.deck: Anubis II is a game developed by Data Design Interactive, the developers behind Ninjabread Man.
results.name: Anubis II

results.deck: A racing game for a variety of consoles based around the Hot Wheels franchise.
results.name: Hot Wheels: Beat That!

results.deck: Archer Maclean Presents: Pool Paradise is a pool game with Jimmy White.
results.name: Pool Paradise

results.deck: A Koei hack and slasher with superdeformed characters.  Characters can augment their powers with elemental forces in one player, or two player simultaneous co-op.
results.name: Mystic Heroes

results.deck: Everblue is the a diving simulation game that follows a man named leo as he explores the ocean depths and discovers marine life. It was released only in Europe and Japan, it never saw a NA release.
results.name: Everblue

results.deck: For the 2008 edition of the 2K series, Jason Spezza of the Ottawa Senators was cover athlete.
results.name: NHL 2K8

results.deck: Side scrolling Power Rangers game set in the Dino Thunder time period.
results.name: Power Rangers: Dino Thunder

results.deck: The game where rhythm action button presses meets bouncing cars
results.name: Lowrider

results.deck: The official game of World Snooker for 2007 now includes World Pool Championships as well.
results.name: World Snooker Championship 2007

results.deck: A fun, cute tennis game which is a spin-off to the Hot Shots series.
results.name: Hot Shots Tennis

results.deck: Based on the television series on the Travel Channel, World Poker Tour lets you plat Texas Hold 'Em with the professionals in six 3D tour exclusive casinos.
results.name: World Poker Tour

results.deck: Robot Warlords is a Sci-fi turn based strategy game that was released on the PS2 back on December 14th 2001. It didn't get very good reviews, or sales and, hence, is very very rare.
results.name: Robot Warlords

results.deck: The EA Sports-published follow up to F1 Racing 2002. It was the last F1 game released by EA Sports.
results.name: F1 Career Challenge

results.deck: A video game based around the Top Trumps card game and the Doctor Who franchise. In addition to regular Top Trumps matches, the game also features a number of mini-games.
results.name: Doctor Who Top Trumps

results.deck: V8 Supercars 2 is a derivative of the TOCA Race Driver 2 game that was released in Australia and New Zealand. It contains all of the tracks from the 2004 V8 Supercars championship including Bathurst and Surfers Paradise.
results.name: V8 Supercars 2

results.deck: A sequel of Bleach: Blade Battlers.
results.name: Bleach: Blade Battlers 2nd

results.deck: This time around Bob is challenged with setting up the stage for the summer festival in Sunflower Valley. He will have to use all of his fixit know how to get the job done on time.
results.name: Bob the Builder: Festival of Fun

results.deck: Movie tie-in game released for numerous platforms in 2007. Basic 3-D adventure game.
results.name: Disney's Meet the Robinsons

results.deck: Shuffle! is a PC visual novel game produced by Navel in 2004 in Japan.  The PC version contains pornographic content, while the more family-friedly PS2 version is recommended for those 15 and up.
results.name: Shuffle!

results.deck: A Japanese wrestling game developed by Spike. Features many real promotions and real licensed Japanese wrestlers.
results.name: King of Colosseum II

results.deck: An improved version of Dead or Alive 2, released in 2000 for the arcades, PS2, and Japanese Dreamcast. It included several upgrades over the original 1999 arcade and Dreamcast versions.
results.name: Dead or Alive 2: Hardcore

results.deck: Bloody Roar 4 is a 3D fighting game developed by Eighting/Hudson Soft in 2003.
results.name: Bloody Roar 4

results.deck: Battle Stadium D.O.N. is a fighting game featuring characters from Dragon Ball Z, One Piece, and Naruto.
results.name: Battle Stadium D.O.N

results.deck: Shining Wind is the 18th game in the Shining series from SEGA.
results.name: Shining Wind
